So the other night at dinner my aunt suddenly tells me she's found the perfect man for me. These are the "good points" she pointed out: A) He's chinese B) He's a dentist (if you knew my family you wouldn't ask...) C) He can sing D) He's from India And he's one of the finalists in Indian Idol 2007. Eye rolls aside I was pretty amazed that this chinese/indian guy was competing and even more surprised that he sings pretty well (this was after checking him out on YouTube). Anyway, there's something you don't see everyday :D Not that I'm considering it or anything, I mean, seriously, for all I know we could be related: How many chinese-dentist families could there be in India? AAANYWAY! Now I'm watching all my fave bollywood songs on YouTube! Here're some for anybody interested though I warn you... unless you've been exposed to it, it does take some getting used to (for one thing instead of the usual 2-3 minutes of english songs, hindi songs are 4-5 minutes or longer!!) :) Mostly the songs that I love are because the lyrics are goooorgeous! And sadly don't translate as beautifully to english though I'll try and leave a translation which you shall not mock lol Tu Jahaan (Where You Are) from "Salaam-Namaste" (Hello-Greetings) Quite a modern story actually. Couple lives together and she gets pregnant, he wants to abort it and she wants to keep it. They break up but have to live together because they put all their savings into their shared house so they avoid each other but then meet at a party of mutual friends. This song is about her longing to have him there as she goes through her pregnancy. i.e. she wishes he would say "where you are is where I'll be. when it's sunny I'll be your shade. when you're alone, I'll be with you." Mere Haath Main (In My Hand) from "Fanaa" (consumed/destroyed... kinda) Blind girl x border rebel posing as tour guide. They fall in love but then he fakes his death and leaves. Years later, she has regained her sight and he stumbles across her secluded cabin unexpectedly after a botched mission. He tries to keep away but can't and she realizes who it is. They plan a happy life, but he can't leave the rebellion and eventually she is forced to kill him. Personally, the 2nd half of the movie sucked >_< but the songs were quite good and this one says "in my hand, put your hand. stay by my side through all our lifetimes. if you are beside me then what else is there? in your love I will be consumed" Kehna Hi Kyaa (What to Say?) from "Bombay" (Bombay/Mumbai) A muslim boy x hindu girl love story (or possibly the other way round, I don't remember) i.e. challenging post-partitian prejudices and such. Basically says "what to say? the person you love is yet a stranger so what do you call him to bring him to you?" Surah Hua Madham (The Sun Melts) from "Kabhi Khushi Kabhi Gham" (Sometimes Happiness Sometimes Sadness) Basically your rich boy x poor girl love story. They fall in love but theirs is an impossible love. The song is about how love makes everything topsy-turvy i.e. "the sun melts, the moon burns... I stand and the earth walks beneath me" My faaaavourite couple of all time! Kajol is too cute!! They were also together in the very very popular movies "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge" and "Kuch Kuch Hota Hai" Mere Mehbooba (My Love) from "Pardes" (Homeland/India) Hmm how to classify this... Arjun is an orphan who was taken in by the family that she is engaged to marry into. But her fiancee Rajeep is a city snob and she is the pure innocent village girl, and she falls in love with Arjun who is trying not to love her since that would be betraying Rajeep's family. The song is about his longing to find love, "someday I will meet you, on that day I will find life. But when will that rain come? My heart is thirsting and alone" does that make sense in english? lol Ae Dil Dil Ki Duniya Mein (In the World of the Heart) from "Yaadein" (Memories) Another rich boy x poor girl love story, though here they were childhood friends but her father owes his father. So to save her father's honour she pushes him away and pretends she doesn't love him because his family wants him to marry this other rich girl. In the song he's all angsty and "tell me you love me" and the song is all "sometimes love is about compromise. you have to laugh on the outside while you're crying on the inside .etc." "I'm in Love" from "Neal and Nikki" Okay you have to watch this one if no other, it's really funny because (also I think parts of it are set in Vancouver) Anyway, it's about Nikki who hires Neal to sing and dance with her on the mountain to make her ex-boyfriend jealous. They're so ridiculous but it's a fun song, with some "interesting" english lyrics... The tune in the beginning and that hand slappy+nose touch thing they do in the middle are allusions to another very famous movie starring Nikki's sister Kajol and all fans will know it and squeal... like I did ... 6_6'

Was reading last night and thus didn't get to bed until about 7a.m. this morning. I couldn't say that it was the "captivating literature" that kept me up since I (sadly) gave into temptation and picked up a few easy-to-read romance novels. I'm saving all my heavy reading for when school starts up and I have to focus on those thousand word essays again. I think it was just my old summer insomnia come back to haunt me. 

Anyway, reading these types of books always make me think about relationships in general and my interpersonal-relationship skills in particular--- which incidentally is generally lacking. It's so frustrating because I know that these stories just idealize romance, sex and love and at the same time I can't help wanting the ideal, and it doesn't help that everyone around me who is actually in a relationship is telling me to be realistic. Because shouldn't love be beyond all you've ever known and seen and heard? 

Blargh! Did that make sense? or is it that I just haven't had enough sleep? I'll think about this some more and probably edit this post to make more sense, but I guess in a perfect world, actual guys would say these actual words. And in a perfect world, I wouldn't laugh in their faces.

I KNEW IT!!!!!!!! >_< As soon as I knew the title (it seems so long ago) I thought it might be him although not for the exact same reason as stated in the book. So, as you can tell, I recently finished reading the sixth installment of the Harry Potter "phenomenon" and I think it was fabulous even when I had tears streaming down my face. I won't say anymore but will put any more HP discussion behind a cut so as not to spoil it for those of you haven't read it yet!! Aaaaand... the Half-Blood Prince is... Snape!!! muahaha (okay, just had to get that out of my system) C'mon, you knew it was coming. Although it did disgruntle me that there wasn't more on Snape's history which I had expected after reading HP5, and I'm still craving more on him so I hope HP7 will continue to bring surprises. I've been reading various forums and journals and there seems to be a consensus of hate toward Snape and Draco but I don't really feel that. In fact, I liked Draco, or atleast I felt much more sympathetic toward him in this book than in any other because you get to see him as a person who obviously cares about his family (though he does mention himself first when talking to Dumbledore). Also, I don't know if I'm being overly optimistic but I still believe in Snape and I don't think Dumbledore was wrong to trust in him. Maybe I'm making too much of it but Dumbledore's last words i.e. "Severus...Please..." sort of make me think it was part of a plan and that Dumbledore knew he was going to die. Anyway, I cried all through those parts, starting with "The Cave" and to the very end, it was just so... and I'm glad that Rowling didn't make it overly dramatic but it was very touching all the same and I'm so sad about what happened but I can't see the book ending any other way. Things that I am happy about Remus and Tonks!!! ^-^ aren't they just adorable? They're two of my favourite characters and Remus really, really deserves some happiness. Did anyone suspect that she was in love with Sirius as Harry did? I was put off by the fact that they're cousins!! Maybe that isn't wierd in Britain but yeah, I thought it might be the guilt but I'm happy to be wrong because they're such a cute couple and I can't wait to draw and see fanart of that ship. Also, another happy thing that surprised me was Bill and Fleur. Although I really hated Fleur through HP4 and later when I found out about her and Bill at the end she really proves herself and I think it's really fabulous how Rowling shows that even the most narcissitic person has redeeming qualities. Something that majorly irritated me, and at the same time I suppose it was a long time coming... what was up with Ron and Hermione? You can hardly believe they're rational, young adults by the way they act! Won-Won was hilarious though XD and I'm glad to see a little development with Ron though not so much with Hermione. Also annoying, you think Harry would've learned about reading from mysterious books, at the same time what he says at the end there is right, summary: that the book didn't make him do it, it only provided the information. gah! too much to say and too little time!! will probably be ranting about this book for a while but now I have to go to dinner T_T Toodles, *~Arwen
